title: Which is the correct first step in solving 5 2x? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is none because that is a meaningless math expression that cannot conceivably be an equation/inequality and thus cannot be “solved”. To get something solvable out of that, I could make it any of the following: 5–2x=0, which I'd solve by carrying 2x to the right thus getting 2x=5 and then dividing by 2, but nothing prevents you from dividing first and carrying later;5+2x=0, and again the steps are carrying something to the right and dividing by the coefficient of x, I'd carry the 5 and then divide by 2;5=2x, where there is just one step, namely dividing by 2;Any of the above with ≤ or ≥ instead of =, and the steps are the same.
First, I have to figure out what you mean by “5 2x”. That space between the 5 and the 2 throws me off. Do you mean 5 times 2x? 5^(2x)? I have no idea.
